text:
:wave: Hello, team! I’m happy to join the HubSpot developers community :relaxed: 
First question, I rotated my access tokens for my private apps but didn’t change the secrets. Do I need to update the secrets in my code?

Hi Team!

Hope all is well!

We are facing a 400 error when doing a POST request to /crm/v3/objects/companies (ID:cf24246f-44b9-472b-8f6e-7e224ce2cca8) and 500 error when doing a POST request to /crm/v3/objects/deals (ID:980928ff-9b82-4ab1-a9ab-531fec3ceb11). Unfortunately, this integration was not built by us so we are not able to debug from our side. Any idea why this happens and how we can fix this issue? Thanks!

Hi, do you see response body?
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/api-request-monitoring>

Hi Bob!
Thanks for your reply. That's what I was afraid of, I was browsing the documentation and I didn't find the way to customize the payload via Private App.
For the moment I think I'll go for making the API call that queries the information I need from the contact but I'll explore the other way of Ops Hub Pro. Is this second option compatible with the flow I am talking about? That is to say, receive notifications of modification and send personalized information of the contact but not activate any internal flow trigger in HubSpot. My goal is to be notified to modify via API a field X of the contact based on these inputs.
I would reach out to your HS rep and ask for help
Hey all! Would also love to get access to the beta channels api once it becomes available. This is a critical feature for us.

Another thing is related with the `record ID` you mentioned. In this case I am not receiving that field but this ones:
`eventId, subscriptionId, portalId, appId, occurredAt, subscriptionType, attempNumber, objectId, propertyName, propertyValue, changeSource, sourceId` .

Which one should I use? I guess that probably the `objectId` one, right?

alright folks hope everyone had a great weekend! so this isn’t a use case we’re super focused on right now BUT have we considered using a product property in order to organize this?

heads up that we are indeed thinking about “views” for products, it seems like this is the route we’ll likely be going down this year for a use case like this

Reminder: *Want to be the first to know when a new API is available or an existing API has a new version?*  We publish all of that on our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Developer Changelog>.  While we do our best to avoid <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/breaking-change-definition|breaking changes> to our APIs, sometimes for security, and reliability we have to. The Changelog is where we’ll post announcements ahead of time about it. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Subscribe to the Developer Changelog> to stay up-to-date on what’s happening in the world of HubSpot development.
<@U06GFNEJRJN> would you be open to connecting with our Product Manager on this?
Yep, rotating the tokens will expire the old one and you need to swap it for the new one

Hi, all. I'm looking at the `/crm/v3/objects/companies/search` endpoint, and it appears that you cannot use a custom property in the `filters`. Is that correct? Would it be possible to search by a custom property if that property was flagged as searchable (in Enterprise)?
